video.title: TEDTalks: Hot Buttons
video.synopsis: TED presents heated debates between controversial figures as they take the stage to make a stand on key issues that society faces around the world.

episodes.synopsis: Environmentalist Brand and civil engineer Jacobson debate the role nuclear energy should play, if any, in examining our energy alternatives.
episodes.title: Stewart Brand + Mark Z. Jacobson: Debate: Does the World Need Nuclear Energy?

episodes.synopsis: Writer-activist Paul Gilding discusses the effects of overpopulation on Earth's dwindling resources and what can still be done to repair the damage.
episodes.title: Paul Gilding: The Earth Is Full

episodes.synopsis: X Prize founder Peter Diamandis shares his optimism for Earth's future, with assurances that humanity's ingenuity is prepared for any eventuality.
episodes.title: Peter Diamandis: Abundance Is Our Future

episodes.synopsis: Economist Robert Gordon laments the looming end to two centuries of American economic growth and examines the main causes for its demise.
episodes.title: Robert Gordon: The Death of Innovation, the End of Growth

episodes.synopsis: IT researcher Erik Brynjolfsson discusses the changing role of human beings in a workplace increasingly populated by machines.
episodes.title: Erik Brynjolfsson: The Key to Growth? Race with the Machines

episodes.synopsis: Harvard's Michael Sandel discusses commerce's role in daily life and the danger of letting money influence access to justice, education and politics.
episodes.title: Michael Sandel: Why We Shouldn't Trust Markets with Our Civic Life

episodes.synopsis: Business school professor Michael Porter explains how corporations can rival governments, NGOs and charities in creating solutions to global problems.
episodes.title: Michael Porter: Why Business Can Be Good at Solving Social Problems

episodes.synopsis: Infamous whistle-blower Edward Snowden talks Internet privacy, with a rebuttal by the National Security Agency's Richard Ledgett.
episodes.title: Edward Snowden: Here's How We Take Back the Internet

episodes.synopsis: Deputy NSA Director Richard Ledgett responds to whistle-blower Edward Snowden's TEDTalk and discusses the fine line between privacy and security.
episodes.title: Richard Ledgett: The NSA Responds to Edward Snowden’s TED Talk
